result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T Gant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid on a monthly basis on a payment plan supervised by his agent.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

records.addlTxt: of JOC.   Return to Sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.    Unable to Forward.
of Right to be personally present during plea and prouncement of judgment.
The defendant appeared by video from the probation office in Green Bay.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the probation office in Green Bay.  Attorney Grams appeared in court.  Waiver of personal appearance filed in court.  Court questioned his understanding of his right to appear in person.  He understood and wishes to appear by video.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 2.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Repeater allegation confirmed by the court with Attorney Grams and the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1), as a repeater contrary to 939.62(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation, concurrent to the probation now serving.  Make efforts to repay the restitution of $9265.40.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment.  CC.  

Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Concurrent to probation/extended supervision now serving.  Pay the restitution of $9,265.40.  Pay on a monthly payment plan set up by his agent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Maintain employment. Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on May 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
